title: Schefter's fantasy football cheat sheet: Value picks and sleepers to target
content: No one is more plugged in to the latest buzz around the NFL than Adam Schefter. We asked him to share his favorite values in fantasy drafts with you.

title: Johnson slams Bears' offense: 'Not good enough'
content: Bears coach Ben Johnson called out a "sloppy" first half in Friday's preseason win over the Chiefs that included a fumble and critical penalties, saying, "We got to get better in a hurry."

title: Cowboys conclude preseason as Parsons looks on
content: Micah Parsons attended Friday night's preseason finale against Atlanta, the only player not to wear a jersey on the sidelines. He declined to answer questions after the game, but cornerback Trevon Diggs answered some on his behalf.

title: Tottenham shines in win over disjointed Man City
content: Tottenham earned a 2-0 away win over Manchester City on Saturday, maintaining their top spot in the Premier League.

title: Wrexham, Mac back bid to save league opponents
content: Wrexham co-owner Rob Mac has supported a U-turn by the club to allow Sheffield Wednesday fans to bring a banner to Saturday's game calling for their owner Dejphon Chansiri to sell the club.

title: Kemp sentenced to home monitoring for shooting
content: Former NBA star Shawn Kemp was sentenced to 30 days of electronic home monitoring for shooting at two men inside a vehicle in a Washington state mall parking lot.

title: Top prospect Chandler debuts with 4-inning save
content: Pirates rookie Bubba Chandler, considered the top pitching prospect in baseball, became the first pitcher to throw four scoreless innings and record a save in his major league debut.

title: Rays' Williams has HR, 3 RBIs in 'amazing' debut
content: Carson Williams homered and went 2-for-4 with three RBIs in his major league debut, a day after the Tampa Bay Rays called up the former first-round pick.

title: Walker tops Zhang at UFC Fight Night in Shanghai
content: Johnny Walker ended a skid of two straight knockout losses by scoring a shocking knockout of his own in a comeback win against Chinese light heavyweight Zhang Mingyang in the main event of UFC Fight Night in Shanghai.

title: NFL preseason Week 3 takeaways and 53-man roster projections: Joe Milton III rebounds with two touchdowns
content: The final games of the 2025 preseason help flesh out key battles ahead of Tuesday's 53-man roster cuts.

title: Preseason report cards for every single rookie selected in the 2025 NFL draft
content: How did Hunter look in training camp? What's next for Shough? We checked in on all 32 teams' rookie classes.

title: Marching bands! Big entrances! Sing-alongs! 36 of our favorite game-day traditions
content: With a new season here, we look at some of the wild, wacky, wonderful reasons we love college football.

title: Projecting the NFL's sack leaders for 2025: Which pass rushers will get after the QB this season?
content: Will Aidan Hutchinson, Micah Parsons or Trey Hendrickson lead the NFL in sacks? Seth Walder projects this season's top sack-getters.

title: Red Sox in must-win mode? Are Yankees back? What you should -- and shouldn't -- believe in the American League
content: How big is this series with New York for Boston? Is Toronto the best team in the AL? We give verdicts on what it all means.

title: How a swing tweak took Roman Anthony to the next level
content: The Red Sox rookie made his Yankee Stadium debut with a bang, but lately, he has been pummeling everybody.

title: 'We are what we drive': How car dealers became college football's power brokers
content: More college football players are driving sports cars than ever before. But the connection between dealers and programs goes back decades.

title: Inside Arch Manning's wild recruitment saga
content: Getting the heir to football's QB dynasty to commit was destined to be crazy. But this was even beyond that.

title: 📉 Barnwell picks five NFL teams set to decline
content: Which teams will take a step back and lose more games this season? We made five picks based on troubling signs, offseason subtractions and more.

title: 💰 Jones: Offer to Parsons was richest for non-QB
content: Jerry Jones said the agreement he believed he made with Micah Parsons would have been the richest ever for a non-quarterback, adding, "Nobody has ever offered him more money than I have to play football. Period."

title: ⛳ Rory: Took home 1,100 Masters flags after win
content: Rory McIlroy said he took all 1,100 pin flags from the Masters Shop after winning at Augusta National in April. "I've waited 17 years to sign that flag in the middle, and I will never complain about doing it."

title: High school coach? Ayesha Curry opens up on spouse Stephen Curry's early career goal
content: Ayesha Curry, who is married to two-time NBA MVP Stephen Curry, revealed he wanted to be a high school basketball coach.

title: Russell Westbrook makes music video cameo with Ciara
content: The NBA free agent made a surprise cameo, showing off his moves alongside the Grammy Award-winning singer.

title: LeBron, KD and an unprecedented next chapter in their 20-year rivalry
content: For two decades, the two superstars have led superteams to NBA glory. Now, for the first time, they're both looking up at one -- and perhaps the best one yet.

title: Brian Robinson Jr. to the 49ers, Devaughn Vele to the Saints
content: Who won the 49ers-Commanders trade? Why did the Saints give up so much for a 27-year-old wide receiver? We sized up preseason NFL deals.

title: PLL quarterfinals preview: Key stats, matchups, how to watch
content: Which teams will advance to take on the Atlas and Outlaws in the next round? Here's what you need to know.

title: Which of the top-10 2025 recruits will play big roles? We have intel on each player
content: These formerly top-10 recruits are ready to start the season. Some will have bigger impacts than others.

title: The best worst transfers: Why the likes of Sancho, Werner were actually smart signings
content: Sometimes, a transfer should work out, but doesn't. Here are the best worst transfers over the past decade in the Premier League and beyond.

title: Reid's annual HBCU watch list: Ranking the top 10 prospects for the 2026 NFL draft
content: Ahead of Saturday's Cricket MEAC/SWAC Challenge Kickoff, we ranked 10 HBCU players who could be on next year's NFL draft radar.

title: 2025 LLBWS success builds on Connecticut championship history
content: The 2025 LLBWS adds to Connecticut's championship appearances at the amateur level. Learn more about the state's collegiate titles now.

title: AFC West preview: Chargers and Broncos will surpass expectations
content: Will the Chargers or Broncos leapfrog the Chiefs? Raiders on the rise? Here are all the odds for each team in the AFC West and our favorite bets.

title: ‘Overlooking each other's history’: Jaishankar takes swipe at US, Pakistan
content: External affairs minister Dr S Jaishankar on Saturday criticised US–Pakistan for “overlooking each other's history,” recalling the Abbottabad raid that killed Osama bin Laden. He again rejected claims of US mediation in the post-Operation Sindoor ceasefire, stressing it was a direct India–Pakistan deal, and warned opposition against compromising farmers’ interests or India’s strategic autonomy.

title: 'Funny that pro-business…': India to US on buying Russian crude oil amid Trump's tariffs
content: Amidst trade tensions with the US, India asserts its right to prioritize national interests in trade deals and oil procurement from Russia. Ministers Jaishankar and Goyal emphasized that trade decisions are guided by national priorities, not geopolitical pressures. Despite tariff challenges, Indian businesses remain confident, and the government is exploring strategies to enhance international trade relationships.

title: Can Sergio Gor re-open the door between US and India?
content: Sergio Gor, a figure with limited prior India expertise but deep ties to President Trump, has been appointed as the US ambassador to New Delhi. While some welcome his direct access to the President as beneficial for US-India relations, others express concern over his lack of experience and the broader trend of prioritizing loyalty over expertise in Trump's ambassadorial appointments.

title: 'My throat is sore': Rijiju slams oppn over 'ruckus'; accuses MPs of 'running away'
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju lamented a sore throat from imploring the opposition to allow smooth Parliament proceedings during the Monsoon session. He criticized opposition MPs for allegedly avoiding government questioning.

title: Zuckerberg’s AI hiring spree: DeepMind CEO says reason is simple
content: Meta is aggressively recruiting AI talent with exorbitant pay packages, reportedly exceeding $100 million, to catch up with industry leaders like Google DeepMind and OpenAI. This intense competition has sparked concerns about escalating costs, while some researchers prioritize mission-driven work over financial gain, as highlighted by Anthropic's focus on impacting humanity.

title: 'He predicted what happened next': Amitabh Bachchan recalls Sachin's brilliance
content: Amitabh Bachchan praised Sachin Tendulkar's exceptional cricketing intellect, recalling instances where Tendulkar accurately predicted game scenarios. Bachchan highlighted Tendulkar's profound knowledge and ability to foresee movements in the game and bowling strategies. Recently, the Tendulkar family celebrated Arjun Tendulkar's engagement and Sara Tendulkar's launch of her Pilates studio, marking significant personal milestones.

title: 'I don’t think he will play ...': Ex-SA star praises selectors for managing Bumrah
content: South African legend AB de Villiers predicted India pacer Jasprit Bumrah won't play every Asia Cup 2025 game due to workload management, despite his inclusion in the squad. De Villiers supported selectors' proactive approach to protect senior players like Bumrah, emphasising the importance of managing workload to get the best performance.

title: Germany welcomes more students from India: New geography of Indian ambition
content: Amid rising visa hurdles, costs, and political tensions in the US, Germany is emerging as the top destination for Indian students. With nearly 60,000 Indian students now enrolled—a 20% annual rise—Germany offers affordable education, English-taught programmes, and streamlined post-study work routes. Meanwhile, the US faces a sharp decline in Indian student arrivals, exacerbated by slow visa processing and policy uncertainty. Indian families are increasingly choosing Germany for its predictability, affordability, and career-aligned academic structure.

title: OpenAI CEO: Fatherhood 'rewired' me; colleagues say Altman's kid will help humanity
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman shared that becoming a father to a baby boy via surrogacy has profoundly impacted him, altering his priorities and potentially improving his decision-making for the future of AI. Colleagues believe parenthood will positively influence his choices. Altman described experiencing immediate neurochemical changes upon his son's birth, coinciding with OpenAI's ambitious expansion plans, including the Stargate initiative.

title: ‘Track stray dogs with GPS, QR codes’: Shimla launches new drive after SC order
content: The Shimla Municipal Corporation has launched a comprehensive stray dog monitoring program using GPS collars and QR codes, aiming to enhance public safety and reduce rabies cases. This initiative follows a Supreme Court directive on stray dog management, emphasizing sterilization and vaccination.

title: ED busts Rs 130 crore illegal call centre scam; seizes 8 luxury cars
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has uncovered a massive scam orchestrated by young individuals operating illegal call centers, defrauding US citizens of over $15 million. Arjun Gulati, Divyansh Goel, and Abhinav Kalra are identified as key individuals running the scam.

title: India suspends US-bound postal services; effective Aug 25 - what’s exempted
content: Effective August 25, 2025, the Department of Posts will temporarily suspend most international postal services to the US due to new customs regulations. The US Executive Order No. 14324 withdraws duty-free exemptions for goods valued up to $800, imposing duties on all goods except gift items under $100. The executive order also outlines new responsibilities for transport carriers and “qualified parties” authorized by US Customs and Border Protection (CBP).

title: SpaceX exit: Elon Musk on 14-year-old prodigy Kairan Quazi’s resignation
content: Elon Musk claims ignorance of Kairan Quazi's SpaceX tenure following the 16-year-old's resignation. Quazi, who joined SpaceX at 14, is transitioning to Citadel Securities, citing a desire for faster-paced challenges. He previously criticized LinkedIn for age-based restrictions, highlighting biases in opportunity access.

title: Watch: Giant Trump effigy paraded at Nagpur festival; protesters oppose tariffs on India
content: During the annual Marbat Utsav in Nagpur, a giant effigy of Donald Trump was paraded to protest the US government's recent tariffs on Indian goods. The festival, rooted in 19th-century traditions of warding off evil, has evolved into a platform for social and political commentary.

title: 'He's a genius!': Bizarre Dhoni stumping leaves AUS wicketkeeper in disbelief
content: During a 2016 T20I between India and Australia, MS Dhoni executed a remarkable stumping of James Faulkner, sparking debate about whether it was intentional or accidental. Faulkner's attempted cut shot deflected off Dhoni's pad onto the stumps, leaving the batter stranded. Alex Carey suggested Dhoni's genius made the improbable seem deliberate, highlighting the respect he commands for his instinctive skills.

title: Easyjet flight scare: Delirious passenger attempts cockpit break-in; jet diverted back to Lyon
content: An Easyjet flight en route from Lyon to Porto made an emergency return after a 26-year-old Portuguese passenger, experiencing delirium, attempted to force his way into the cockpit shortly after takeoff. Fellow passengers restrained the individual until the plane landed back in Lyon, where police took him into custody.

title: 'It's weird': AB de Villiers baffled by Shreyas Iyer’s Asia Cup snub
content: AB de Villiers expressed surprise at Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from India's Asia Cup squad, despite Iyer's strong IPL performance, Champions Trophy contribution, and leadership qualities. De Villiers speculated that non-cricketing factors, such as team dynamics or an abundance of leaders, might have influenced the selectors' decision, urging further inquiry into the matter.

title: Taylor Swift & Travis Kelce: Iconic Super Bowl photo immortalized; Chiefs Hall of Honor nod
content: Taylor Swift's monumental impact on the Kansas City Chiefs during their Super Bowl-winning 2024 season has earned her a spot in the team's Hall of Honor. Her relationship with Travis Kelce brought unprecedented attention and viewership to the team and the NFL. Swift's presence transcended sports, blending music, pop culture, and football in a way that redefined the Chiefs' season.

title: 'Expelled for praising Yogi': SP rebel Pooja Pal; claims removal boosted Atiq Ahmed's supporters
content: Pooja Pal, expelled from Samajwadi Party, alleges her removal boosted Atiq Ahmed's supporters after she praised CM Yogi and criticized the gangster. In a letter to Akhilesh Yadav, she expressed fears for her life, accusing the party of endangering her and warned that SP would be responsible if she were murdered like her husband.

title: Watch: Massive fire erupts at Louisiana auto supply plant; residents ordered to evacuate
content: A major explosion and fire erupted at Smitty’s Supply in Louisiana, a lubricant and automotive fluid manufacturer, prompting immediate evacuations within a one-mile radius, including an elementary school. Multiple agencies, including the EPA and LDEQ, are responding to the incident, monitoring air quality, and providing support.

title: White House backs DUI deportation bill: Green card and visa holders at risk; immigrants on edge
content: A proposed law in the US may change immigration rules. It could lead to deportation for green card holders with past DUI offenses. Even a single DUI conviction could create problems. This affects visa applications and reentry after foreign travel. Immigration lawyers advise green card holders to apply for citizenship now.

title: Cong MLA arrested after massive hoard of cash recovered; gold worth Rs 6 cr seized
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) apprehended Karnataka Congress MLA KC Veerendra in Gangtok for allegedly leasing land for a casino. This arrest followed raids on 30 of his properties, uncovering Rs 12 crore in cash, including foreign currency, gold jewellery valued at Rs 6 crore, and 10 kgs of silver. The ED also froze 17 bank accounts and seized property documents.

title: J&K: Hizb sleeper cell busted; OGW arrested, linked to cross-border terror handler
content: Jammu and Kashmir Police's SIA made a significant breakthrough by apprehending Altaf Hussain Wagay, an over-ground worker linked to Hizbul Mujahideen. Wagay, a resident of Shopian, was operating as a sleeper cell, facilitating terror activities in the region. Investigations revealed his direct links with a Hizb handler operating from across the border, orchestrating anti-national activities.

title: Top 5 entertainment news: Govinda’s team admits Sunita Ahuja filed for divorce & more
content: The entertainment world is buzzing with news, as Govinda's team addresses past divorce filings while the actor makes a public appearance amid current rumors. An AI tool mimicking Sushant Singh Rajput sparks controversy, drawing criticism from his family. Meanwhile, Zayed Khan commends Hrithik and Sussanne's post-divorce relationship, and Mouni Roy gracefully shuts down a critical comment about her appearance.

title: Ex-cricketer's wife dies at supermarket - 'We were to retire together'
content: Wiyada Pauline, 46, wife of former Surrey cricketer Duncan Pauline, unexpectedly passed away at a Waitrose supermarket in Esher. Emergency services responded to a medical emergency call but were unable to revive her. Duncan Pauline, 64, expressed his devastation, revealing they had planned to retire together in the near future. Police confirmed no suspicious circumstances surrounded her death.

title: Married man dies after hotel sex with lover in China; woman fined Rs 7.5 lakh
content: A Chinese court has ordered a woman, Zhuang, to compensate the family of her deceased married lover, Zhou, with 62,000 Yuan. Zhou died of a heart attack after a hotel encounter. The court found Zhuang secondarily responsible for not seeking immediate help and for violating public order by having an affair, while the hotel was absolved of any fault.

title: In pics: Rohit Sharma gifts personal cricket items to the MCA museum - complete list
content: The Mumbai Cricket Association is set to unveil the Sharad Pawar Cricket Stadium, featuring a museum with significant contributions. Rohit Sharma has donated his jersey and bat from the 2023 ODI World Cup, enriching the museum's collection. The facility will also showcase memorabilia from other Mumbai and Indian cricket legends, offering a unique glimpse into cricketing history.

title: ODI World Cup 2027: SA to host 44 matches, Zimbabwe & Namibia 10; CSA confirms 8 venues
content: Cricket South Africa (CSA) has revealed plans for the 2027 ICC Men’s Cricket World Cup, featuring 44 matches across eight South African cities, with Zimbabwe and Namibia hosting 10 matches. Former minister Trevor Manuel leads the Local Organising Committee, aiming for a unifying event.

title: Canada to accept TOEFL Essentials for permanent residency applicants
content: Foreign nationals applying for Canadian permanent residency will soon be able to use the TOEFL Essentials test to demonstrate English proficiency. Recognized by Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC), the test complements existing options like CELPIP, IELTS, and PTE Core. Designed to assess real-life communication skills, TOEFL Essentials offers faster results and greater flexibility for economic immigration applicants.

title: 'We will all miss you man': LeBron James honors Lee Corso; College GameDay legend retires
content: LeBron James paid tribute to Lee Corso, the legendary ESPN college football analyst, on Instagram following Corso's retirement announcement. Corso, who dedicated nearly 40 years to college football broadcasting, received heartfelt tributes from various ESPN analysts, including Kirk Herbstreit and Nick Saban. Corso expressed gratitude to ESPN, his colleagues, and fans for their support throughout his career.

title: Dharmasthala case U-turn: Whistleblower who alleged multiple burials arrested
content: A former sanitation worker in Karnataka is now under arrest. He claimed he was forced to bury murder victims in Dharmasthala. The worker alleged this happened over several years. He filed a complaint and even provided skeletal remains. Police registered a case and are investigating the claims. The man also sought protection for himself and his family.

title: TMC terms JPC a 'farce'; won't nominate anyone for committee
content: All India Trinamool Congress criticized the Joint Parliament Committee. The party declared it would not nominate anyone. This decision relates to bills concerning the removal of the Prime Minister and Chief Ministers. The bills were sent to the JPC after introduction in Lok Sabha. The party opposes the constitutional amendment bill. Tensions rose in Lok Sabha during the bill's introduction.

title: Virat Kohli ready for Australia series? Post-practice images from the UK viral
content: Virat Kohli's training images from London have sparked excitement among fans as he prepares for the upcoming ODI series in Australia. Spotted at Lord's Cricket Ground, Kohli balanced practice with leisure, spending time with wife Anushka Sharma. Despite discussions about farewell matches, BCCI clarifies that Kohli and Rohit Sharma continue to be vital players in the ODI format.

title: BBA student mauled by stray dogs in Kanpur; cheek torn, receives 17 stitches
content: In Kanpur, a 21-year-old BBA student, Vaishnavi Sahu, suffered a brutal attack by stray dogs while returning from college. The dogs knocked her down and severely mauled her face, requiring 17 stitches. Locals intervened, chasing the dogs away. Vaishnavi is currently hospitalized and unable to eat due to the severity of her injuries.

title: Lamar Jackson vs Commanders: Injury update on Ravens’ star; will he play today?
content: Baltimore Ravens fans received positive news as coach John Harbaugh confirmed that Lamar Jackson is fine after a foot injury scare during practice. An X-ray revealed no significant damage, and Jackson is expected to be ready for Week 1. Cooper Rush is set to start the preseason finale against the Commanders, as Jackson was already slated to sit out.

title: Mumbai rains: Animal shelter housing 91 strays floods; 2 dogs, 3 cats die
content: Devastating floods in Vasai's Naigaon, triggered by heavy rains and mangrove destruction, severely impacted Jeet Bhatti's animal shelter, claiming the lives of two dogs and three cats. Bhatti, with his uncle's help, rescued many animals, aided by the forest department and NGOs like Yoda and Furacause.

title: Kavikulaguru Kalidas Sanskrit University VC Hareram Tripathi, wife killed in accident
content: Kavikulaguru Kalidas Sanskrit University's Vice-Chancellor, Prof. Hareram Tripathi, and his wife tragically died in a road accident near Kushinagar, Uttar Pradesh. Prof. Tripathi, a distinguished scholar, had significantly contributed to the university by securing grants and initiating research projects during his tenure. His untimely demise has been mourned by leaders nationwide, recognizing his immense contribution to Sanskrit scholarship.

title: Lucknow: 2 minors raped by stepfather who was jailed for killing their biological dad
content: In Gomtinagar, Lucknow, two minor sisters, aged 12 and 14, bravely reported their stepfather to the police, accusing him of repeated rape over several months. The sisters managed to escape and contacted 1090, detailing the abuse and their mother's dismissal of their claims.

title: US envoy to India: Why did Musk call Trump pick Sergio Gor ‘a snake’ once?
content: Sergio Gor, a close aide to Donald Trump, has been nominated as the US Ambassador to India, sparking controversy due to past clashes with Elon Musk. Musk previously labeled Gor a "snake" and accused him of legal violations related to security clearance paperwork. Trump defended Gor, emphasizing his loyalty and importance to US-India relations amidst ongoing tariff disputes.

title: Cloudburst in U'khand: Houses, vehicles under debris; woman trapped, man missing
content: A cloudburst in Chamoli, Uttarakhand, triggered debris flows that damaged homes, trapping a woman. The IMD has issued an orange alert for intense rainfall and thunderstorms across several districts. Landslides have blocked key roads in Pithoragarh, and rescue teams are addressing a blocked Yamuna River causing flooding in Barkot tehsil.

title: 'India in golden age of space': Shubhanshu Shukla on National Space Day
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla highlighted India's thriving space exploration phase during National Space Day celebrations, emphasizing the excitement surrounding upcoming missions like Gaganyaan and lunar landings. He noted international interest from agencies in Japan and Europe eager to collaborate.

title: ‘If you don’t like it, don’t buy it’: Jaishankar slams sanctions on Russia oil
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar staunchly defended India's energy ties with Russia, emphasising their role in stabilising global oil prices and serving national interests. He asserted India's right to autonomous decision-making, addressing criticism over Russian crude purchases by stating that Europe and America also engage in such transactions.

title: UP man walks into DM office with dead newborn in bag; pleads to revive baby
content: In Lakhimpur Kheri, a grieving father walked into the DM's office with his dead newborn, alleging that a private hospital's negligence caused the infant's death. Vipin Gupta claimed his wife, Rubi, received incorrect medication. The DM has pledged to cover Rubi's medical costs.

title: Bank fraud case: FIR registered against Anil Ambani; CBI raids premises linked to RCOM
content: The CBI raided premises linked to Reliance Communications and Anil Ambani concerning a suspected large-scale bank fraud, following an FIR registration. This action follows the ED's questioning of Ambani regarding a money laundering probe involving over Rs 17,000 crore in bank loan frauds.

title: 'We reached Moon and Mars': PM Modi marks National Space Day
content: Prime Minister Modi addressed the nation on National Space Day, celebrating India's space achievements and the accomplishments of its scientists and astronauts. He emphasized India's rapid progress in space technology, including the development of semi-cryogenic engines.

title: 'Caught stealing bat': 14-year-old kills girl in Hyderabad
content: In Hyderabad, a shocking incident unfolded as a 14-year-old boy was apprehended for allegedly murdering a 10-year-old girl. Police suspect the motive stemmed from the girl catching him attempting to steal a cricket bat from her residence.

title: NFC West preview: 49ers and Rams top odds, but don't count out Seahawks and Cards
content: The NFC West projects to be a tight, four-team race. Here are the odds for each team and our favorite bets.

title: How mid-major coaches are embracing -- or resisting -- being high-major launchpads
content: Some mid-major coaches lean into pitching their programs as a development step. Others are reluctant.

title: CBI facilitates return of extortion case fugitive from Azerbaijan
content: An extradition request was sent to the Azerbaijan authorities on January 7, 2025, after CBI got an Interpol Red Notice in 2024

title: Trump tariffs: India should explore the option of ‘decoupling’ from the U.S. and diversifying its export destinations, says Biswajit Dhar
content: Trade policy expert suggests India diversify its exports and engage with developing countries amid U.S. tariff policies.

title: Aviation summit highlights potential of air taxis for Kerala’s urban mobility
content: Panel discussion on the first day of a two-day summit in Kochi explores the potential of air taxis, including helicopters, seaplanes, and eVTOLs for urban mobility

title: Onam campaign: Mona Lisa gets a Malayali make-over on Kerala Tourism’s social media posts
content: Kerala’s Tourism social media post gives Leonardo da Vinci’s Mona Lisa a Malayali make-over, featuring the lady of the iconic painting attired in Kerala’s traditional off-white ‘kasavu’ saree and her hair adorned with  jasmine flowers

title: A.P. govt. forms advisory group to strengthen inclusive education in State
content: The government has also proposed to establish one autism centre in each of the 125 municipalities across the State

title: India-Australia FTA: Another round of talks for comprehensive trade pact conclude
content: The negotiations covered a wide range of areas, including goods, services and mobility, digital trade, rules of origin, legal and institutional provisions, environment, labour, and gender

title: Expert team clears roof truss for P&T apartment complex after stability check
content: Interim report by the team finds overall structural performance meets safety and serviceability criteria as per AISC manual; solar panels planned to address residents’ complaints over rising power bills

title: E-waste will be collected at people’s doorstep soon in Andhra Pradesh, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Dedicated fleet of vehicles will be deployed for the purpose with the aim of creating wealth from waste, says the Chief Minister; he also announces a ₹330-crore waste-to-energy plant in Peddapuram to generate 15 MW of power

title: No complaint received against Rahul Mamkootathil, says Deepa Dasmunshi
content: AICC general secretary calls controversy a “closed chapter” as CPI(M) and BJP step up demand for MLA’s resignation

title: Stalin’s presence at Ayyappa devotees’ meet will be an insult to Hindus: BJP
content: BJP state president Rajeev Chandrasekhar slams CPI(M)-DMK alliance over Sabarimala issue; also demands resignation of Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil

title: National Mental Health Survey-2 to cover 5 districts, four urban areas in Kerala
content: NMHS 2 aims to estimate prevalence of mental disorders, psychosis, assess disability and care pathways, examine socioeconomic impact, and characterise mental disorders in vulnerable populations.

title: Centre to revive diversified fish farming in Kuttanad
content: Modern and traditional aquaculture practices like integrated fish farming, cage fish farming, the sustainable “one fish one paddy” initiative, and biofloc fish farming to be implemented

title: Netanyahu Calls UN's Declaration Of Famine In Gaza A "Modern Blood Libel"
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office has dismissed the United Nation's declaration of famine in Gaza and called it an "outright lie" and "modern blood libel".

title: US Defense Intelligence Agency Chief Fired. He Had Denied Trump's Iran Claim
content: The move comes after the Defense Intelligence Agency findings appeared to contradict US President Donald Trump's earlier statements.

title: 5-Year-Old Boy's Body Found In Train Toilet Dustbin In Mumbai
content: Workers cleaning a train at a station in Mumbai were in for a huge shock on Saturday when they found a five-year-old boy's body in the dustbin of a toilet.

title: Mountain Mudslide In Pakistan Creates 7-Km Lake, "Catastrophic" Floods Feared
content: A 7-km lake in northern Pakistan, created by a mountain mudslide, is threatening to burst and unleash potentially "catastrophic" floods downstream, officials warned on Saturday.

title: Iran Says It Has Built Weapons Factories In "Several Countries": Report
content: Iran's defence minister, Aziz Nasirzadeh, has said that the Islamic Republic has set up weapon production facilities in "several countries," roughly two months after the nation was involved in a deadly aerial war with Israel.

title: India To Temporarily Stop Postal Services To US From August 25
content: The Department of Posts announced in a statement on Saturday that all postal services to the United States will be temporarily suspended from August 25.

title: Woman Slapped 8 Times In 38 Seconds For Feeding Dogs In Ghaziabad
content: She was slapped eight times in nearly 40 seconds by a man. Her fault: she was feeding dogs near his apartment complex in the national capital region.

title: Newlywed Woman, 19, Found Hanging In UP's Ballia, Suicide Suspected: Cops
content: In a suspected case of suicide, a 19-year-old newly-married woman was found hanging in her in-laws' house at Sheikpur village in Ballia district on Saturday, police said.

title: Teacher Thrashed For Protesting Against Public Drinking In West Bengal: Cops
content: A drawing teacher was allegedly thrashed by a group of youths in Belgharia in North 24 Parganas district, after he protested against their public drinking early on Saturday morning, police said.

title: Fake Marriage Racket Busted In Jammu, 5 Including 'Bride' Arrested: Cops
content: Five persons, including a woman from Uttar Pradesh, were arrested after police busted an inter-state racket involved in orchestrating fake marriages to extort money from unsuspecting grooms here, officials said on Saturday.

title: 1-Year-Old Girl Kidnapped From UP Railway Station, Search Underway: Cops
content: A one-year-old girl was abducted from Platform No. 1 of Mathura Junction Railway Station on Friday night while her family was sleeping, police said.

title: 5 Killed, 8 Injured Amid Heavy Rainfall In Jharkhand
content: Five people were killed, one person was missing, and several others were injured as heavy rains wreaked havoc in parts of Jharkhand, officials said on Saturday morning.

title: Elon Musk Takes On Bill Gates' Microsoft With 'Macrohard'. What It Is
content: Elon Musk has launched a new artificial intelligence (AI) venture under his xAI initiative, taking on the mighty Microsoft. The project, Macrohard, was announced by Musk on X (formerly Twitter) on August 22.

title: "Don't Like It, Don't Buy It": S Jaishankar Defends Importing Russian Oil
content: There are some "red lines" in the India-US trade deal negotiations, Foreign Minister S Jaishankar has underscored amid strained relations with the US over several aspects in bilateral trade where India has refused any concession to President Trump.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why Joint Parliamentary Committees Are An Exercise In Futility
content: The Trinamool Congress and the Samajwadi Party decided not to nominate any of its members to the Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) being proposed to examine the Constitution (One Hundred and Thirtieth Amendment) Bill, calling the committee a farce.

title: On US-Pak Ties, S Jaishankar's Reminders On History, Osama Bin Laden
content: On US President Donald Trump's claim of mediating a ceasefire between India and Pakistan during Operation Sindoor, Mr Jaishankar said that while he had spoken to the US side, the cessation of hostilities was decided between New Delhi and Islamabad.

title: "Slept With Epstein Once, Thought We Are Going To...": Ghislaine Maxwell
content: Ghislaine Maxwell, the convicted associate of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, has said that she "slept" with him one time, and her first thought was that they were soon going to start dating.

title: "Don't Believe He Died By Suicide": Jeffrey Epstein's Aide On His Death
content: The Justice Department released a transcript on Friday of an interview with Ghislaine Maxwell, the accomplice of Jeffrey Epstein.

title: 59 Days After Arrest, 40,000-Page Charge Sheet Against Akali Dal's Bikram Majithia
content: Within 59 days of arrest, the Punjab Vigilance Bureau on Friday filed a 40,000-page charge sheet in a Mohali court against Shiromani Akali Dal leader Bikram Singh Majithia, who was arrested in a disproportionate assets case.

title: "A Farce": Trinamool On House Panel For PM, Chief Minister Removal Bills
content: The TMC on Saturday termed as "farce" the JPC formed to look into the three bills that lay down the framework for the removal of the prime minister and chief ministers, saying it will not send any member to it.

title: No one has the right to stop legitimate voter registration: George Kurian
content: Union Minister slams Congress and CPI(M) for spreading ‘propaganda’ over voter list, says no BJP worker has ever added a fake vote or engaged in bogus voting

title: 10 years on, Vizianagaram woman gets life sentence for murdering husband and daughter
content: Two accomplices get seven years in jail; surviving children to receive ₹14 lakh as police win decade-long battle through meticulous investigation and forensic evidence

title: PM Modi to inaugurate PMAY houses, launch ₹5,477 crore projects during two-day Gujarat visit
content: The Prime Minister will hold a 3-km roadshow on August 25 evening in Ahmedabad. He will inaugurate 1,449 houses in Ahmedabad and will launch projects worth ₹1,796 crore in Mehsana district

title: Clay Ganesh idol-making competitions to be held at IGMC Stadium on August 26
content: Collector G. Lakshmisha asks participants to celebrate Vinayaka Chavithi with clay idols and protect the environment

title: Rajasthan High Court bans use of 86,000 dilapidated classrooms in government schools
content: According to the report, Rajasthan has 63,018 government schools with 5,26,162 classrooms. Of these, 86,934 were found to be completely dilapidated.

title: Parties in Kashmir criticise govt takeover of JeI-linked schools
content: Justice and Development Front (JDF) J&K – formed by the members of the banned JeI – denounced the government move, saying it was an “administrative overreach” and a “painful reminder” of the National Conference’s “history of betrayal”

title: Godavari floods: 4,700 families in Polavaram project submergence area affected in A.P.
content: With the inflows into the Godavari exceeding 10 lakh cusecs, the first flood warning remains in force at Sir Arthur Cotton Barrage at Dowleswaram

title: Suchitra Junction experiment reduces wait time, but adds distance for some; commuters divided
content: At peak hours, commuters once waited over 20 minutes to cross the junction, said a traffic police officer. Now, sparing a brief pedestrian halt, traffic flows smoothly from all sides, cutting the wait to just two minutes, he said.

title: Ganesha Chaturthi: Old timers recall glory days of music, Harikathe and fun in pandals in Bengaluru
content: The tradition of installing Ganesha idols in many areas for at least 15 days to a month and celebrating with various cultural activities is now rarely followed, a result of changing priorities and restrictions by authorities in a burgeoning city

title: Children’s trilingual poets’ meet in Dharwad
content: The Children’s Academy Dharwad has organised 22nd “Makkala Tribhasha Kavi Ghosti”, a children’s trilingual poets’ meet in Dharwad on August 30

title: Naidu to release HNSS waters to Kuppam on August 30
content: HNSS project envisages providing irrigation and drinking water to the regions that receive less rainfall in Rayalaseema districts; present Kuppam branch canal is projected to benefit thousands of acres in Kuppam and surrounding mandals

title: Man booked in Sri Sathya Sai district for false disability pension claim, misleading video
content: Authorities say Ramesh is at large following a police case, with details sent for further legal action

title: Delhi Police nabs man wanted in multi-state cheating cases for over a decade from Goa
content: Investigations revealed that Kaushik and his associates operated call centres to target victims across India

title: 4.6 kg elephant tusks seized in Assam
content: A person arrested is being questioned to get to a wider network of ivory smugglers in the region, the police said

title: Kerala government sanctions one instalment of DA and DR to employees, pensioners
content: The instalment will be disbursed with the salary and pension payable on September 1, says Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal

title: Financial distress continues due to high debt and low revenue growth, says Jagan
content: A glance at the performance of the coalition government on the fiscal front exposes its failure, says the YSRCP president

title: ICMR offers indigenous tech to replace CT/MRI scans for traumatic brain injuries, seeks support from State governments
content: CEREBO is a portable, handheld, non-invasive brain injury diagnostic tool that can provide colour-coded, radiation-free and cost-effective results; it is safe for infants and pregnant women

title: Telugu Desam Party MLA urges Tungabhadra Dam officials to complete gate works on schedule
content: Kaluva stresses need for timely completion to safeguard irrigation and drinking water supplies in Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka

title: Sikkil Gurucharan displays consummate mastery over Carnatic music in Palakkad
content: Carnatic vocalist performs at Chembai Music College and IIT Palakkad in events organised by SPICMACAY

title: Suvendu trains guns on Mamata’s Bhabanipur, TMC zooms in on Nandigram
content: Suvendu Adhikari has commissioned a “special survey” in Bhabanipur to map booth-level strengths and weaknesses, studying where the chief minister’s party led in 2021 and where it lagged

title: KSEB in a fix over new pole rental rules
content: KSEB faces financial loss due to new telecom rules, seeks amendment or compensation from State government.

title: Pressure mounts, but Rahul Mamkootathil to continue as legislator
content: Despite no formal complaints being filed against him, he had voluntarily stepped down from the position of the Youth Congress State president, says Mamkootathil. However, he emphasised that there was no circumstance that warranted giving up his MLA seat

title: Mahayuti can't win if polls are conducted with honesty: Uddhav Thackeray
content: They (Mahayuti alliance) cannot win if elections are held honestly, certainly not in Maharashtra. Rahul Gandhi has exposed how they stole votes. He has torn their `burqa' (veil), says Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray

title: 14,000 new polling booths likely in Bengal; all-party meet on August 29
content: Political circles feel the expansion will pose organisational challenges, particularly for Opposition parties, which may find it difficult to deploy booth-level agents (BLAs) across the increased number of stations

title: Ladakh administration cancels land allotment to institute; Wangchuk, Leh body term move ‘witch-hunt’
content: Leh Apex Body (LAB), which along with Kargil Democratic Alliance (KDA) is spearheading an agitation in support of the demand over the past four years, also criticised the decision and said they will not remain silent and any consequences will rest with those trying to "suppress our voice"

title: UGC’s draft curriculum framework is primitive, unscientific: Students Federation of India
content: The SFI’s statement remarked on the salutation to goddess Saraswati at the start of the chemistry curriculum, and V.D. Savarkar’s inclusion in the reading list for Independence struggle, terming it an attempt to ‘intensify saffronisation’

title: SCBA supports lawyer strike, says L-G notification undermines courts' sanctity
content: The SCBA secretary released a statement saying they believed that the L-G’s notification gravely affected the independence of the judiciary and fair administration of justice

title: T.N. Prathapan alleges district administration blocking records on Suresh Gopi’s vote additions
content: Congress leader alleges that State government also had a role in this fraudulent vote-adding process

title: Meghwal defends 130th Constitutional Amendment Bill, cites Kejriwal's refusal to resign while jailed
content: Defending the Bill, Arjun Ram Meghwal said AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal didn't resign as Delhi Chief Minister when he had been incarcerated

title: Kerala Congress criticises IAS Association over ‘selective outrage’
content: The association condemned personal attacks on Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar and his family on social media; the party questioned the association’s silence during the alleged political witch hunt of then Election Commissioner Ashok Lavasa in 2019

title: Police issue guidelines for peaceful Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations in Guntur District
content: Necessary approvals from municipal, fire, and electricity departments must also be secured and organizers are required to keep fire safety measures like sand and water at the venues, the District Superintendent of Police said

title: Shafi Parambil parries queries on allegations against Rahul Mamkootathil
content: The Congress MP, who was at Vadakara town on Saturday, dismisses media reports and social media campaigns accusing him of keeping a silence over the issue

title: NDA takes onus to dedicate Polavaram irrigation project to the nation, commissioning in 2027, says A.P. Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu
content: It is not Amarvati which is inundated in stormwater, but the political party that led the campaign is sinking, says Mr. Naidu

title: Two wanted criminals arrested in separate encounters in Meerut and Muzaffarnagar
content: In Meerut, a criminal carrying a reward of ₹25,000, who was wanted in a cow slaughter case, was arrested following a police encounter late Friday night

title: TMC leaders claim aggressive Ravneet Singh Bittu pushed Abu Taher in Lok Sabha
content: Trinamool Congress leaders alleged that during the protest, Abu Taher, who had been in a hospital for months, was standing at the edge of the Well of the House when Mr. Bittu "forcefully and violently" pushed him

title: Parliament Monsoon Session ends with record ‘low productivity’ | Infographic
content: Frequent disruptions, stalled Question Hour, and no private members’ business marked the Monsoon Session.

title: Fantasy buzz: How does the Commanders' backfield shape up after Robinson trade?
content: fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . Christian McCaffrey has averaged 19.8 touches and 21.8 fantasy points per game since arriving in San Francisco .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Spurs turn to Nkunku after Eze snub
content: arsenal have already spent over £250m this summer, with £67.5m the latest amount needed to bring in Eberechi Eze . but the club are still chasing a winger and Lyon need to raise around €40m to help their financial situation .

title: The favorites to the underdogs: Ranking the US Open contenders
content: the new big two of men's tennis is overwhelmingly favored to make it three straight Slam finals against each other . Aryna Sabalenka is a brilliant 67-13 on the season but has fallen short late in all three Slams and must fend off a torrid Iga Swiatek .

title: How fan favorite Shilo Sanders is handling the spotlight
content: the spotlight has followed undrafted rookie safety Shilo Sanders since he set foot in Tampa . astonished Sanders says he didn't know y'all was waiting on him . fans greet him as he prepares for the 2025 season .

title: ⚾ The feud between Madonna and Evansville, IN
content: EVANSVILLE, INDIANA, is one of America's biggest small towns . residents are proud of their town's resilience during the 1937 flood . they're proud of the city's role in world war II as a major manufacturing hub .

title: 💯 Ranking the top 100 college football players
content: a list of the top 10 college football players entering the season is no easy task . it requires a mix of information, reporting and assumptions . some choices are easy and some projections are nearly universally agreed upon . at least a few will be hisman Trophy contenders by season's end .

title: 'To confuse people': Prashant Kishor accuses PM Modi, Rahul of blame game
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Why guaranteed money, late signings for second-round picks are an NFL trend to watch
content: the NFLPA filed a grievance alleging the league colluded to limit fully guaranteed player contracts . the players received a substantial windfall in the second round of this year's draft . they benefit from fully guaranteed contracts for seven players in the round .

title: 🏈 2025 Fantasy Football Draft Guide
content: this draft guide will serve as a one-stop shop for all of our best material as you prepare to make the best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot at a championship.

title: Matchup in Ireland is among the last for the Farmageddon football rivalry
content: two fan bases from Middle America are likely baffling locals by arguing over their teams . the rural-rooted rivalry is getting a rare but well-deserved turn in the spotlight . both are nationally ranked; the Wildcats check in at No. 17 and the Cyclones at 22 .

title: 2025 preseason College Football Playoff predictions
content: college football reporters predict the 12 schools that will make up the college football Playoff beginning in December . the odds are updated every week following that week's games . Ohio State won the inaugural 12-team bracket last season, despite starting as the no. 8 seed .

title: Premier League updates: Villa in action after Spurs stun Man City
content: Welcome to an exciting Saturday of action in the  Premier League  and around Europe! The day kicked off with  Manchester City  losing  2-0  to  Tottenham Hotspur  at the Etihad Stadium, while  Arsenal  host  Leeds United  in the other marquee matchup in England. Elsewhere, the first round of  Bundesliga  games continues and the  Serie A  season gets underway Join us for all the highlights and big moments from the day's action!

content: the fantasy football landscape changes every year to make us reconsider the way we approach drafts . an exciting rookie comes into the league and fantasy expectations go through the roof with the hopes of what could be . Become ESPN fantasy football's ultimate champ .

title: ⚾ How Lucas Erceg uses his sobriety to inspire
content: the softball field at Boonville Correctional Center has two fences . the first is a standard outfield fence stretching from foul line to foul line . it's a stark reminder that the field is, quite literally, a diamond in the rough .

title: Six unlikely CFP stars and what they do for an encore
content: wide receiver Jaden Greathouse will be different as no. 6 Notre Dame opens the season at no. 10 Miami . Greathouse entered the college football playoff semifinal at the orange bowl with only six receptions for 49 yards in his previous five games . the wide receiver had a career-high 66 receiving yards for the season .
